rdt.tree.builder

Class SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • rdt.tree.builder.BatchTreeBuilder
      • rdt.tree.builder.MultilabelChainTreeBuilder
        • rdt.tree.builder.SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TreeBuilder

    public class SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder
extends MultilabelChainTreeBuilder
    Class for a SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder. This tree-builder is specialized to build trees for sparse datasets. Currently the tree-builder can only handle binary nominal attributes. The idea of this tree-builder is to use the SparseSplitter to find good attributes to split. This tree-builder has still the same functionality as the normal MultilabelChainTreeBuilder.
    Author:
    MK

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder(CollectorPreferences cp, int maxDeep, int maxS, long randomSeed, double percentageLabels)
      Creates a new SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder with the given information about the learning tasks, the maximum depth of the trees, the minimum number of instances to create an inner-node, the random seed and the percentage of label-splitters which should be contained in the tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder

        public SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder(CollectorPreferences cp,
                                        int maxDeep,
                                        int maxS,
                                        long randomSeed,
                                        double percentageLabels)
                                 throws RDTException
        Creates a new SparseMultilabelChainTreeBuilder with the given information about the learning tasks, the maximum depth of the trees, the minimum number of instances to create an inner-node, the random seed and the percentage of label-splitters which should be contained in the tree.
        Parameters:
        cp - information about the learning tasks
        maxDeep - the maximum depth of the trees which will be built
        maxS - the minimum number of instances to create an inner-node
        randomSeed - the random seed
        percentageLabels - the percentage of label-splitters which should be contained in the tree
        Throws:
        RDTException
